member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasRoundedRectangle
member.summary: Describes a rectangle with rounded corners.

remarks.p: Each corner of the rectangle specified by Rect is replaced with a quarter ellipse, with a radius in each direction specified by RadiusX and RadiusY.

If the RadiusX is greater than or equal to half the width of the rectangle, and the RadiusY is greater than or equal to one-half the height, the rounded rectangle is an ellipse with the same width and height as the rect.
Even when both RadiusX and RadiusY are zero, the rounded rectangle is different from a rectangle. When stroked, the corners of the rounded rectangle are roundly joined, not mitered (square).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasRoundedRectangle.Rect
member.summary: The coordinates of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasRoundedRectangle.RadiusX
member.summary: The X axis (horizontal) radius for the quarter ellipse that is drawn to replace every corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasRoundedRectangle.RadiusY
member.summary: The Y axis (vertical) radius for the quarter ellipse that is drawn to replace every corner of the rectangle.
